Major_Arcs.title: Introduction and Romantic Conflict in Ghost Town
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the characters Nan and Cal in a Western setting juxtaposed with modern elements, establishing Nan's stubborn personality and the initial romantic conflict regarding a visit to Ghost Town.

sub_scenes.title: Saloon Surprise and Stubborn Refusal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Nan and Cal and the initial conflict: Nan's surprise about something being real and her rejection of Cal's romantic advances and invitation to visit the ghost town.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction to Ghost Town and the Stubborn Woman

Major_Arcs.title: Modernization Threat and Emotional Response
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to the modern era, revealing the impending destruction of Ghost Town due to airport construction and Nan's emotional distress and conflict with her father over this modernization.

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Departure and Modern Revelation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Nan's solo journey to Ghost Town, her reflections on it, and the abrupt shift to a modern setting where the airport plan is revealed.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Reflections on the Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Breakdown and Airport Impact
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the immediate reactions to the airport announcement, culminating in Nan's emotional breakdown upon realizing the ghost town's imminent destruction.

narrative_arcs.title: Disbelief, Explanation, and Nan's Emotional Reaction to Ghost Town Demolition

sub_scenes.title: Father-Daughter Conflict and Humiliation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Nan's confrontations with her father regarding the airport project, his dismissal of her feelings, and her resulting humiliation and emotional distress.

Major_Arcs.title: Reconciliation and Snowstorm Crisis
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shows Nan and Cal reconciling amidst the backdrop of a severe snowstorm and the community's response to the crisis, culminating in a romantic resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation and Parental Perspectives
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Nan and Cal's reconciliation and the differing perspectives of Nan's parents on their relationship and the situation.

sub_scenes.title: Resolve and Approaching Crisis
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Nan's resolve to understand her feelings for Cal, her confrontation with him, and the escalating weather crisis.

narrative_arcs.title: Yore Dad's Deal and No Backing Down

sub_scenes.title: Confession, Impulsivity, and Growing Loneliness
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Nan and Cal's deeper conversation, Nan's impulsive action with the horses, and her subsequent experience of loneliness.

sub_scenes.title: Accusations, Weather Concerns, and Hope
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene portrays continued tension between Nan and Cal, worsening weather conditions, and a glimmer of hope amidst the storm.

narrative_arcs.title: Accusations and Defensiveness in the Snow
Seeking Comfort and Hope Amidst the Storm

sub_scenes.title: Despair, Rescue, and Romantic Recognition
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts initial despair due to the relentless snow, the unexpected arrival of aid through 'Operation Hay Lift', and Nan and Cal's final romantic recognition amidst the crisis resolution.

narrative_arcs.title: Waking Up to Snow and Hopelessness
The Sound of a Plane and Hopeful Fodder Drop
Joyful Recognition of Fodder and Cal's Foresight

Major_Arcs.title: Chane Benson and Town Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chane Benson and his impact on the town, focusing on Jeff's fascination with him, Sally's concerns, and the conflict resolution through a newspaper article and Chane's departure.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Chane Benson and Jeff's Idolization
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Chane Benson through his actions and the townspeople's reactions, and then shifts to Jeff's idolization of his brother and guns.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflecting on Jeff's Brother and Past

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Fear and Clyde's Plan
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Sally's growing fear for Jeff, her plea to Clyde for help, and their shared resolve to guide Jeff away from a dangerous path.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Fear and Plea to Clyde

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Confrontation and Newspaper Article
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Sally's confrontation with Mr. Benson, the introduction of the newspaper article, and escalating tensions related to it.

narrative_arcs.title: Defense of Past Actions and Article Mention
Warning about Benson and the Article

sub_scenes.title: Article Fallout and Benson's Justification
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Sally's angry confrontation with Clyde about the article, Benson's explanation for staying in town, and the escalating tension.

sub_scenes.title: Dinner Invitation and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the dinner invitation to Benson, leading to a gathering, and the eventual resolution of the conflict with Chane Benson leaving town.

narrative_arcs.title: Article's Impact and Doubts about Clyde
Challenge for a Fair Fight and Anxious Wait
Printing the Clarion and Family Legacy

sub_scenes.title: Sally and Chane's Moonlight Encounter and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene presents a flashback to a romantic encounter between Sally and Chane and then shifts to a heated confrontation where Sally realizes Jeff is Chane in disguise.

sub_scenes.title: Jealousy, Fight, and Chase for Clyde
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Jeff's jealousy, his fight with Chane, and Sally's urgent chase to save Clyde from Chane.

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy and Steve Daley - Range War and Romance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Steve Daley and Betsy, depicting a range war conflict, the development of their romance, and the resolution through Steve giving up his guns and their commitment to each other.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Steve Daley and Initial Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Steve Daley as the new boss and sets up initial conflicts and tensions related to his arrival and the ranch situation.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley as 'The Boss'
Discussion of Betsy's Ranch and Approaching Trouble

sub_scenes.title: Clarification, Impending War, and Ride to Town
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene clarifies Steve Daley's role, discusses the looming range war, and shows Steve and a woman heading to town.

narrative_arcs.title: Clarifying Steve Daley's Role and Concerns
Discussion of Impending Range War and Local Troubles
Offer of a Ride and Acceptance
Hank's Orders and Waiting for Dress Material

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Bodyguard Decision
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts a confrontation in town, a physical fight, and Betsy's decision to hire Steve as a bodyguard.

narrative_arcs.title: Post-Purchase Conversation and Steve Daley Mention
Discussion of Steve Daley's Abilities and Impending Danger
Decision to Hire Bodyguard and Ranch Philosophy

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Stance and Romantic Development
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Betsy clarifying her stance against gunslingers, Hank's gratitude, and the developing romantic tension between Betsy and Steve.

narrative_arcs.title: Clarification on Firing and Stance Against Gunslingers
Gratitude, Personnel Change, and Hank Yuh's Request
Love's Proof and Surrender of Guns

sub_scenes.title: Range War Escalation and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the escalation of the range war, Hank's ambush, Betsy's firm stance, and the resolution of the conflict with Steve and Betsy together.

narrative_arcs.title: Declaration of War and Betsy's Authority
Aftermath and Suspense at Devil's Pass

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie, Fred, and Dave - Love, Betrayal, and Reconciliation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers on Carrie, Fred, and Dave, exploring themes of love, betrayal, and reconciliation within a complex romantic triangle and business dealings related to the Carlton contract.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Conflict and Fence Dispute
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Mary and Dave in conflict, shifts to concern about Curley, and then transitions to a fence dispute involving an older man and younger woman.

sub_scenes.title: Fence Confrontation and Tense Standoff
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts a tense confrontation at the fence, escalating from accusations to a near gunfight, and de-escalating with a rejection.

narrative_arcs.title: Unexpected Visitors and Accusation of Fence Damage

sub_scenes.title: Post-Confrontation and Romantic Interlude
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows the immediate aftermath of the fence confrontation, a reflective conversation between Dave and Carrie, and a romantic interlude interrupted by Fred's reappearance.

narrative_arcs.title: Confusion about Friendship and Second Chances
Romantic Interlude and Dismissal of Conflict

sub_scenes.title: Love Confession and Proposal Flashback
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene includes a conversation about Dave and Fred, Miss Bronson's love confession for Fred, Dave's attempt at reconciliation, and a flashback to Carrie and Fred's romantic proposal.

narrative_arcs.title: Confession of Love for Fred Gordon
Desire to Bury the Hatchet and Romantic Overture
Flashback to Romantic Words and Proposal

sub_scenes.title: Betrayal, Confrontation, and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reveals the betrayal related to the Carlton contract, Carrie's angry confrontation, her resolve to fight back, and a final confrontation at Carlton's office leading to a resolution and Carrie's emotional aftermath.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Dave and the Carlton Contract
Arrival and Confrontation at Carlton's Office

sub_scenes.title: Regret, Confession, and Flashback
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Carrie's regret and confrontation with Fred, her chance encounter with Dave leading to a confession of love for Fred, and a flashback to her father's wisdom.

narrative_arcs.title: Apology and Inquiry about Feelings for Fred
Wagon Ride and Direct Confrontation about Love

sub_scenes.title: Illness, Revelation, and Reconciliation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene features Carrie's illness, the revelation about the beef contract, and her final reconciliation with Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: The Beef Contract Revelation and Reconciliation with Fred

Major_Arcs.title: Chris and Ransom - Duty and Love
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Chris and Marshal Ransom, exploring their developing romance amidst a crisis involving Dirk, duty versus love, and culminating in their marriage proposal.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Plea and Secret Meeting
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene begins with Dirk's urgent plea to Carrie for help and transitions to a secret, disguised meeting between them.

narrative_arcs.title: Dirk's Urgent Arrival and Plea for Help
The Secret Meeting and Dirk's Disguise
Dirk's Gunshot Wound and Medical Examination

sub_scenes.title: Investigation and Marshal's Arrival
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows an investigation into Dirk's situation and the arrival of Marshal Ransom at the ranch, initiating his search for Dirk.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern and Investigation into Dirk's Situation
Marshal Ransom's Arrival and Inquiry about Dirk
Confrontation with Rance Cready and Suspicion at the Ranch

sub_scenes.title: Legal Stance and Negotiation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Marshal Ransom's legal stance on Dirk's actions and the woman's plea for leniency and negotiation regarding Dirk's immediate fate.

sub_scenes.title: Reflection, Night Encounter, and Argument
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the woman's internal reflection on Dirk's situation, a nighttime encounter with Marshal Ransom, and their subsequent heated argument.

sub_scenes.title: Love Confession, Escape Plan, and Internal Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Chris and Ransom's love confession, Chris proposing an escape plan for Dirk, and Ransom's internal conflict regarding his duty and feelings.

narrative_arcs.title: Escape Plan Proposal and Seeming Agreement

sub_scenes.title: Pursuit, Confrontation, and Gunfight
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows the pursuit of Dirk and Chris, Dirk's reflection on failed evasion, the Marshal's confrontation, and the ensuing gunfight and its immediate aftermath.

sub_scenes.title: Moral Dilemma and Dirk's Escape
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene presents the moral dilemma of whether to kill the injured Marshal, their decision not to, Dirk's escape facilitated by Chris, and Ransom's realization of Chris's deception.

sub_scenes.title: Recovery, Confession, and Marriage Proposal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Ransom's recovery, his and Chris's emotional confessions, and their marriage proposal amidst the unresolved situation with Dirk.

sub_scenes.title: Pre-Wedding Anxiety and Interruption
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Chris's pre-wedding anxieties, her conversation with Rance, and the dramatic interruption of their wedding by Dirk.
